Our dynamic programming algorithm works as long as either the set
(i.e., has a linear ordering), while the other set can have an arbitrary
-dimensional embedding. Moreover, we can also extend our algorithms to ordinal elections
We now consider fault tolerance in multidimensional elections. Unsurprisingly, the optimal
committee design problem is intractable — it is similar to facility location — but it turns
out that the seemingly simpler variants ORP and FTS are also intractable.
All three problems (Optimal Replacement, Fault-Tolerance Score, and
Optimal Fault-Tolerant Committee) are NP-hard, in any dimension
norm, where size of the committee
We will use a single construction to show NP-hardness all three problems. Our proof
uses a reduction from the NP-complete problem
